summary.para: The ITfTextInputProcessorEx.ActivateEx method activates a text service when a user session starts. If the text service implements ITfTextInputProcessorEx and ActivateEx is called, will not be called.

param.name: ptim
param.para: [in] Pointer to the ITfThreadMgr interface for the thread manager that owns the text service.

param.name: tid
param.para: [in] Specifies the client identifier for the text service.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: [in] The combination of the following bits:

description.para: A text service is activated as secure mode. A text service may not want to show the setting dialog box.
A text service is activated as com less mode. TSF was activated without COM. COM may not be initialized or COM may be initialized as MTA.
The current thread is 16 bit task.
A text service is activated for console usage.

returns.para: The TSF manager ignores the return value of this method.

summary.para: The ITfTextInputProcessorEx interface is implemented by a text service and used by the TSF manager to activate and deactivate the text service. The manager obtains a pointer to this interface when it creates an instance of the text service for a thread with a call to CoCreateInstance.
